page.title: 04St. Lucia's Church.
page.content: St Lucia's church is believed to have existed in the 12th centuary , which makes the church 800 years old . St. Lucia's church has a square tower which is 18m (59 ft 9ins) high . It is a solid building with buttresses on the outside of the walls.These support the walls to keep them straight and secure. The breadth of the church is approx 12m long and the length is approx 32m long , the area of the church covers approx 384 sq.m. The area of the church yard is approx 4384sq.m. The iron bit going up the isle is called a grill . Underneath the grill there is a hole in the floor which leads down to the old heating for the church . In the west end of the church lying in the vestry is a memorial of Walter Barker. He is dressed in Elizabethan armour.
